number_patterns.title: What do numbers tell you?
number_patterns.expression_number_desc: Calculated from your name, this number reflects potential themes and characteristics in your life.
number_patterns.shadow_side_footer: These aspects can be transformed with awareness. Accepting the shadow is not empowering it - it is integrating it.
number_patterns.ancient_secret_desc: Number patterns form an ancient reflection system using mathematical symbolism. From Pythagoras to ancient traditions, many cultures explored the meaning of numbers. Your birth date and name can be used as themes for self-reflection and personal exploration. Each number represents symbolic qualities to consider. This is a tool for introspection and self-awareness.
number_patterns.kadim_content: Since Pythagoras, many traditions have explored symbolic meanings of numbers. Your life path number is a reflection theme - a way to think about personal qualities and life patterns. These symbolic associations can be useful for journaling and self-discovery.

breath_awareness.name: Breath Awareness
breath_awareness.instruction: Close your eyes. Take three deep breaths. With each breath, say 'I am here now.'

heart_listening.name: Heart Listening
heart_listening.instruction: Place your hand on your heart. For one minute, just listen to the sound of your heart.

flow_intention.name: Flow Intention
flow_intention.instruction: Today, instead of forcing something, let it flow. Just watch what happens.
flow_intention.intention: When control is released, flow begins.

gratitude_moment.name: Gratitude Moment
gratitude_moment.instruction: Count three things you're grateful for today. Feel them.

silence_minute.name: Silence Minute
silence_minute.instruction: Do nothing for one minute. Just be.

intention_setting.name: Intention Setting
intention_setting.instruction: Set a single intention for today. Repeat it three times in your mind.

body_scan.name: Body Scan
body_scan.instruction: Scan your body from toes to head. Notice the tense areas.

dreams.welcome_message:
Hello, I am Dream Trace. I'm here to explore your dreams through the lens of your {signName} archetype.

Describe your dream in detail. What did you see? How did you feel? The more you share about the symbols, colors, and emotions in your dream, the deeper the reflection will be.

interpretations.sign_perspective: Through the lens of your {archetype} archetype:

pioneer.basic_meaning: Water, for your fire archetype, is a call to dive into emotional depths. Subconscious energies want to surface.
pioneer.element_perspective: Water's calming energy has come to balance your fire nature. Time for patience and rest. A period of reflection before action.
pioneer.psychological:
Water: Subconscious, emotions, mother archetype
As a Pioneer: Suppressed emotions want to surface
Message: Not just running, but sometimes pausing to feel is needed
pioneer.practice:
‚Ä¢ Meditate by the water
‚Ä¢ Set your intention while showering
‚Ä¢ Allow your tears
‚Ä¢ Write your feelings down

builder.basic_meaning: Water, for your earth archetype, symbolizes fertility and abundance. Material and emotional flow is entering your life.
builder.element_perspective: Water nourishes earth - this dream may reflect growth and prosperity. Trust your natural rhythm, let go without forcing.
builder.psychological:
Water: Emotional security, comfort, nourishment
As a Builder: The connection between inner peace and material security
Message: Emotional wealth attracts material wealth
builder.practice:
‚Ä¢ Water your plants, tend your garden
‚Ä¢ Take a bath ritual
‚Ä¢ Visualize financial flow
‚Ä¢ Make relaxation and comfort your priority

nurturer.basic_meaning: Water is your element - this dream is extremely meaningful! There is a powerful message from your inner depths.
nurturer.element_perspective: This dream indicates a deep connection with home, family and your roots. The mother archetype is active. Your inner home is calling.
nurturer.psychological:
Water: Subconscious, intuition, protective instinct
As a Nurturer: The need for emotional protection and home
Message: Return home - to your inner home, your inner home
nurturer.practice:
‚Ä¢ Drink a warm cup of tea mindfully
‚Ä¢ Look at family photos
‚Ä¢ Take a relaxing bath
‚Ä¢ Clean the house - renew the energy
‚Ä¢ Connect with mother figures

transformer.basic_meaning: Water is your element and this dream indicates deep transformation! Time for renewal has come.
transformer.element_perspective: Don't fear diving into the depths of water. There are treasures there. The cycle of death and rebirth is active.
transformer.psychological:
Water: The deepest layers of the subconscious
As a Transformer: Time for shadow work
Message: Instead of fearing darkness, illuminate it
transformer.practice:
‚Ä¢ Do deep meditations
‚Ä¢ Keep a shadow journal
‚Ä¢ Practice letting go ritual
‚Ä¢ Embrace deep inner transformation
‚Ä¢ Consider speaking with a trusted person or professional

dreamer.basic_meaning: Water is your element - your connection with deeper awareness is very strong! You can fully trust your intuition.
dreamer.element_perspective: You're experiencing deep inner oneness. Creative inspiration is flowing. Ideal period for artistic expression.
dreamer.psychological:
Water: Universal consciousness, renewal, collective subconscious
As a Dreamer: Deep experiences and inner guidance
Message: You are beyond water - you are the ocean
dreamer.practice:
‚Ä¢ Artistic creation - painting, music, writing
‚Ä¢ Meditation by sea or lake
‚Ä¢ Lucid dream practices
‚Ä¢ Inner reflection work
‚Ä¢ Be open to inner guidance

default.basic_meaning: Water carries emotional messages for your {element} archetype. The subconscious wants to flow.
default.element_perspective: Water's fluid energy is communicating with you. A call to dive into emotional depths.
default.practice:
‚Ä¢ Spend time by water
‚Ä¢ Express your emotions
‚Ä¢ Trust the flow, let go of forcing
‚Ä¢ Listen to your intuition

flying.title: ‚úàÔ∏è FLYING DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
flying.basic_meaning: Flying represents the desire for freedom and transcending limits. Personal ascension and consciousness expansion.
flying.special_interpretation: This dream shows you the potential to conquer new heights in your life. Time to break free from limiting beliefs has come.
flying.psychological:
‚Ä¢ Flight altitude: Indicates your level of consciousness
‚Ä¢ Flight speed: Symbolizes the speed of change
‚Ä¢ Difficulty: Reflects the obstacles you face
‚Ä¢ Ease: Shows your inner freedom level
flying.flight_style:
‚Ä¢ Gliding: State of flow in life
‚Ä¢ Flapping: Difficult but achieved goals
‚Ä¢ Unable to rise: Suppressed potential
‚Ä¢ Falling: Fear of losing control
flying.practice:
‚Ä¢ Write your fears and burn them
‚Ä¢ Go to a high place, look at the view
‚Ä¢ Repeat 'I can fly' affirmation
‚Ä¢ Set intention for lucid dreaming
flying.cosmic_message: Your entries suggest you have untapped potential ‚Äî explore it. As a {element} element, {element_message}.

falling.title: ‚¨áÔ∏è FALLING DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
falling.basic_meaning: Falling reflects the fear of losing control or insecurity in an area of your life.
falling.special_interpretation: Focus on grounding work. This dream is giving you the message 'your feet need to touch the ground.'
falling.psychological:
‚Ä¢ Where you fell from: Which area has insecurity
‚Ä¢ Fall speed: Level of loss of control
‚Ä¢ Hitting ground: Anxiety about fears being realized
‚Ä¢ Waking before: Escape mechanism active
falling.attention:
‚Ä¢ Areas in life where you've lost control
‚Ä¢ Signs of excessive stress and anxiety
‚Ä¢ Meeting of basic needs
‚Ä¢ Work-life balance
falling.practice:
‚Ä¢ Walk barefoot on the earth
‚Ä¢ Do grounding meditation
‚Ä¢ List your security needs
‚Ä¢ Practice breathing exercises
falling.cosmic_message: Falling is actually letting go. Let go of the illusion of control, trust the process. As a {element} element, grounding practice is especially important.

death.title: üíÄ DEATH DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
death.not_scary: Death in dreams symbolizes transformation and new beginnings. This is not an end, it is transformation!
death.special_interpretation: This dream means old patterns are dying and a new self is being born. Think about what you need to let go of in your life.
death.psychological:
‚Ä¢ Your own death: Ego transformation, new self
‚Ä¢ Someone else's death: What that person represents is ending
‚Ä¢ Unknown person's death: General life change
‚Ä¢ Return from death: Renewal and gaining power
death.transformation:
‚Ä¢ Career change
‚Ä¢ Relationship transformation
‚Ä¢ Renewal of beliefs
‚Ä¢ Identity evolution
‚Ä¢ Lifestyle change
death.practice:
‚Ä¢ Make a list of what needs to let go
‚Ä¢ Review old photos
‚Ä¢ Clean out your wardrobe
‚Ä¢ Identify habits that need to 'die'
death.cosmic_message: You're being reborn from your ashes like a phoenix. {archetype} strengths empower this transformation. A new you is being born!

chase.title: üèÉ CHASE DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
chase.basic_meaning: Being chased is a call to face something you're running from in life. The more you run, the bigger the chaser grows!
chase.special_interpretation: With your {element} energy, bravely turn around and ask what's chasing you. Usually what we run from are the lessons we need most.
chase.psychological:
‚Ä¢ The chaser: Shadow archetype - your rejected aspects
‚Ä¢ Running: Avoidance of confrontation
‚Ä¢ Being caught: Opportunity for shadow integration
‚Ä¢ Can't escape: Denial no longer works
chase.chaser:
‚Ä¢ Fear or anxiety
‚Ä¢ Suppressed anger
‚Ä¢ Postponed responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Avoided relationship issues
‚Ä¢ Unmet needs
chase.practice:
‚Ä¢ In your dream, stop and talk to the chaser
‚Ä¢ Ask 'What do you want?'
‚Ä¢ Practice active imagination technique
‚Ä¢ Identify what you're running from and take small steps
chase.cosmic_message: The chaser is actually you - a suppressed aspect of yourself. Embrace and integrate it. Your enemy can become your friend.

animal.title: üêæ ANIMAL DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
animal.basic_meaning: Animals represent our instinctual nature and suppressed energies. Each animal carries a totem message.
animal.special_interpretation: This dream is a call to reconnect with your natural instincts. Research the totem energy of whichever animal you saw.
animal.common_symbols:
‚Ä¢ Snake: Transformation, renewal, inner growth
‚Ä¢ Dog: Loyalty, protection, friendship
‚Ä¢ Cat: Independence, mystery, intuition
‚Ä¢ Bird: Freedom, intuitive messages
‚Ä¢ Wolf: Community, leadership, teacher
‚Ä¢ Bear: Strength, protection, introspection
‚Ä¢ Horse: Freedom, power, passion
animal.psychological:
‚Ä¢ Animal's behavior: Your suppressed behavior
‚Ä¢ Your relationship with animal: Your relationship with instincts
‚Ä¢ Animal's color: Emotional tone
‚Ä¢ If animal attacks: Suppressed energy eruption
animal.practice:
‚Ä¢ Research that animal - mythology, symbolism
‚Ä¢ Do a guided meditation visualizing the animal
‚Ä¢ Journal about what the animal represents to you
‚Ä¢ Notice that animal in your daily life
animal.cosmic_message: Animals in dreams often represent your instincts and inner strengths. As a {element} archetype, this symbolism may be especially meaningful.

house.title: üè† HOUSE/BUILDING DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
house.basic_meaning: Houses and buildings symbolize your inner structure and inner world. Each room represents different aspects of your self.
house.special_interpretation: Think about which 'room' you're avoiding entering. As a {element} element, the structure of your inner world is important.
house.room_meanings:
‚Ä¢ Basement: Subconscious, suppressed memories
‚Ä¢ Attic: Higher aspirations, long-term goals
‚Ä¢ Kitchen: Nourishment, creativity
‚Ä¢ Bedroom: Privacy, sexuality
‚Ä¢ Bathroom: Purification, emotional cleansing
‚Ä¢ Living room: Social aspect, relationship with outer world
‚Ä¢ Secret rooms: Unexplored potential
house.house_states:
‚Ä¢ New house: New self, change
‚Ä¢ Ruined house: Neglected aspects
‚Ä¢ Childhood home: Roots, past
‚Ä¢ Strange house: Unknown potential
house.practice:
‚Ä¢ Clean the room you visit least in your home
‚Ä¢ Renew house corners with energy
‚Ä¢ Draw a map of your inner world
‚Ä¢ Do 'inner home' meditation
house.cosmic_message: The house is you. Each room is an aspect of you. Explore and own them all.

love.title: üíï LOVE DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
love.basic_meaning: Love-themed dreams reflect relationship dynamics and emotional needs.
love.special_interpretation: This dream may signal a new period in your love life. Ask 'How is my relationship with myself?'
love.dream_types:
‚Ä¢ Ex-partner: Incomplete feelings
‚Ä¢ Stranger: New potential or desire
‚Ä¢ Your partner: Relationship dynamics
‚Ä¢ Celebrity: Desired qualities
‚Ä¢ Platonic love: Emotional needs
love.scenarios:
‚Ä¢ Kissing: Desire for union
‚Ä¢ Separation: Fear of loss
‚Ä¢ Marriage: Desire for commitment
‚Ä¢ Being cheated on: Insecurity
‚Ä¢ Fighting: Inner conflict
love.psychological:
‚Ä¢ Anima/Animus: Opposite gender archetype
‚Ä¢ Projection: Seeing your own qualities
‚Ä¢ Need: Unmet emotional requirements
love.practice:
‚Ä¢ Take a love language test
‚Ä¢ List your relationship needs
‚Ä¢ Work on self-worth
‚Ä¢ Heart-centered meditation
love.cosmic_message: Love yourself first. {element} element in love life {element_message}.

money.title: üí∞ MONEY/WEALTH DREAM - {archetype} INTERPRETATION
money.basic_meaning: Money and wealth dreams represent self-worth and abundance consciousness. They carry a message of inner, not material, wealth.
money.special_interpretation: This dream invites you to question your relationship with the material world. True wealth is inner peace and gratitude.
money.dream_types:
‚Ä¢ Finding money: Incoming opportunities, abundance
‚Ä¢ Losing money: Insecurity, fear of loss
‚Ä¢ Being rich: Awareness of potential
‚Ä¢ Counting money: Need for control
‚Ä¢ Giving money: Generosity or power loss
money.symbols:
‚Ä¢ Gold: Inner wealth, wisdom
‚Ä¢ Cash: Daily security
‚Ä¢ Treasure: Hidden potential
‚Ä¢ Jewels: Self-worth
‚Ä¢ Bank: Security and structure
money.psychological:
‚Ä¢ Money = Energy exchange
‚Ä¢ Wealth = Self-worth perception
‚Ä¢ Poverty = Feeling of inadequacy
‚Ä¢ Abundance = Inner harmony
money.practice:
‚Ä¢ Repeat abundance affirmations
‚Ä¢ Keep a gratitude list
‚Ä¢ Question your relationship with money
‚Ä¢ Practice generosity
money.cosmic_message: Your reflections point toward abundance - be a receiver. {element} element in financial matters {element_message}.

generic.title: {archetype} DREAM INTERPRETATION
generic.subconscious: The dream you described shows that your subconscious is sending you important messages.
generic.element_perspective: With your {element} element's energy, the core message of this dream seems to be related to {element_message}.
generic.emotion:
Focus on the emotions in your dream:
‚Ä¢ Fear: Need for security
‚Ä¢ Happiness: Indicator that you're on the right path
‚Ä¢ Confusion: The unknown is being explored
‚Ä¢ Sadness: Incomplete feeling
‚Ä¢ Anger: Suppressed energy
generic.symbol_reading:
Note the main symbols in your dream:
‚Ä¢ People: Represent your aspects
‚Ä¢ Places: Map of your inner world
‚Ä¢ Objects: Tools and resources
‚Ä¢ Actions: Your approach to life
generic.practice:
‚Ä¢ Keep a dream journal
‚Ä¢ Set intention before sleeping
‚Ä¢ Research symbols
‚Ä¢ Connect through meditation

personal_advice.pioneer: Advice: Write down your first thoughts when you wake up in the morning. Your fire energy can quickly make you forget subconscious messages.
personal_advice.builder: Advice: Write your dreams in a dream journal. Your earth energy works better with tangible records.
personal_advice.communicator: Advice: Tell your dream to someone. Your air energy loves to find meaning through verbal expression.
personal_advice.nurturer: Advice: Track your dream patterns over time. Your water energy tends to produce vivid, emotionally rich dreams.
personal_advice.performer: Advice: Express your dreams creatively - draw, write, share. Your fire energy loves expression.
personal_advice.analyst: Advice: Keep a list of dream symbols. Your earth energy appreciates systematic analysis.
personal_advice.harmonizer: Advice: Focus on relationships in your dreams. Your air energy draws lessons from social dynamics.
personal_advice.transformer: Advice: Do deep meditation. Your water energy is very powerful for diving into subconscious depths.
personal_advice.explorer: Advice: Interpret your dreams philosophically. Your fire energy loves to see the big picture.
personal_advice.achiever: Advice: Think about how to apply your dreams to practical life. Your earth energy wants concrete results.
personal_advice.visionary: Advice: Join dream communities. Your air energy is nourished by collective wisdom.
personal_advice.dreamer: Advice: Set intention before sleep. Your water energy can connect directly with inner guidance.

insight.title: Insight
insight.intro: I'm here to help you reflect on what's on your mind. Whether it's a dream, a feeling, a decision, or just something you want to explore - I'm here to listen and ask questions that might help you see things from a new angle.
insight.disclaimer: This is a space for personal reflection, not advice.

welcome.morning: Good morning! What would you like to reflect on today?
welcome.afternoon: Good afternoon! What's on your mind?
welcome.evening: Good evening! Ready for some reflection?

responses.dream_falling:
Falling dreams are among the most common experiences people report. Many find these dreams surface during times when they're navigating uncertainty or feeling like aspects of life are beyond their control.

I'm curious whether this dream has been recurring - the pattern itself might be worth exploring. What's been happening in your waking life lately? Sometimes our minds process daytime concerns through nighttime imagery.

What does falling feel like in the dream - is it frightening, freeing, or something else entirely?
responses.dream_water:
Water dreams are something many people experience. Water can represent different things for different people - sometimes emotions, sometimes change, sometimes cleansing.

What was the water like in your dream? Was it calm, turbulent, deep, shallow? The specific qualities might connect to what's happening in your waking life.

How did you feel during the dream?
responses.dream_flying:
Flying dreams are among the most memorable dream experiences. Many people associate them with feelings of freedom, gaining perspective, or escaping limitations.

Was the flight effortless or were you struggling? Were you flying high or staying close to the ground? These details might hold personal meaning for you.

How did you feel while flying - exhilarated, scared, in control?
responses.dream_chase:
Being chased in dreams is something many people experience. It often surfaces when we're feeling pressured or avoiding something in waking life.

Do you remember what was chasing you? And were you able to escape or were you caught? These details might be worth exploring for what they mean to you.

Is there anything that's been "chasing" you in your mind lately - something you've been avoiding?
responses.dream_teeth:
Teeth dreams are among the most commonly reported dream themes. Different people experience them differently - some see teeth falling out, some breaking, some loose.

Many people associate these dreams with concerns about self-image, communication, or some kind of transition in their lives.

What exactly happened in the dream, and how did it make you feel?
responses.dream_general_1:
Thank you for sharing your dream. Dreams can be a way our mind processes thoughts and feelings that our waking mind doesn't always get to address.

What was the dominant feeling during the dream? And do you sense any connection to what's been happening in your life recently?

What part of the dream stayed with you most?
responses.dream_general_2:
That's an interesting dream experience. Dreams are often our subconscious mind's way of processing our thoughts and experiences.

What was the most vivid part of the dream? And how did you feel when you woke up - relieved, unsettled, curious?

Has anything happened recently that might have triggered this dream?
responses.pattern_1:
Noticing a pattern is a powerful sign of self-awareness. Many people live inside cycles without ever recognizing them.

Do you remember when this pattern first started? And what feelings or situations typically accompany this pattern?

How do you feel when you notice yourself in this pattern?
responses.pattern_2:
Patterns often try to tell us something - recurring behaviors or situations usually connect to a deeper need or belief.

What does this pattern give you? Sometimes the things we repeat serve us in some way, even if it's hard to recognize.

If you wanted to break this cycle, what would your first step be?
responses.emotion_anxiety:
Anxiety can be a challenging feeling to sit with. It's often our body's way of saying something needs our attention - even if it's not always accurate.

Where do you feel the anxiety most - in your body, your thoughts, or both? And what typically triggers it?

Is there anything that's been helping you cope with this anxiety right now?
responses.emotion_sadness:
Sadness is a natural emotion that helps us process our experiences. Sometimes it signals that something matters to us.

When did this sadness start? And do you know what it's connected to - a specific event, or is it more of a general feeling?

How are you taking care of yourself right now?
responses.emotion_anger:
Anger often signals that our boundaries have been crossed or that we sense something isn't fair. It's an important emotion to pay attention to.

What do you think is at the root of this anger? And how do you typically express this feeling - do you hold it in or let it out?

Could there be other feelings underneath this anger?
responses.emotion_overwhelmed:
Feeling overwhelmed is a signal that we're facing demands that exceed our current capacity. This feeling is valid and something many people experience.

Can you identify what feels most overwhelming right now? Sometimes naming just one thing can make things feel more manageable.

Have you had a chance to take a breath?
responses.emotion_general:
Being in touch with your emotions is an important self-awareness skill. Whatever you're feeling is valid.

How long has this feeling been present? And where do you feel it in your body?

What do you need most right now?
responses.decision_1:
Decision-making can be challenging, especially when there are multiple valid options. Being able to see both sides is actually a sign of thoughtful consideration.

If you imagined the best outcome of each choice, which one excites you more? And what would be the worst outcome of each?

What does your gut tell you?
responses.decision_2:
Decisions often require us to balance multiple values at once. Could there be conflicting values that make this decision feel difficult?

Looking back a year from now, which choice would you want to have made?

What's preventing you from seeing this decision more clearly?
responses.relationship_1:
Relationships can be some of the most meaningful yet challenging aspects of our lives. Each relationship has its own dynamics.

What are you feeling most in this relationship right now? And do you know what you're hoping for from this relationship?

In an ideal scenario, what would this relationship look like?
responses.relationship_2:
Challenges in relationships often reveal something about our needs or boundaries.

What matters most to you in this situation? And have you been able to express that to the other person?

How do you feel about yourself in this relationship?
responses.self_discovery_1:
The journey of self-discovery is a lifelong process. Asking questions shows you're already on this path.

When do you feel most like yourself in life? And when do you struggle to feel like yourself?

How would someone who knows you best describe you?
responses.self_discovery_2:
Discovering who we are takes courage. Every experience teaches us something about ourselves.

Have you ever thought about what your values - what you truly care about - are?

What would you change in your life right now?
responses.general_1:
Thank you for sharing what's on your mind. Sometimes just putting thoughts into words can help us see them more clearly.

What's been weighing on you the most? And how long has this been on your mind?

What outcome would you hope for?
responses.general_2:
It sounds like you have a lot going on. Taking time to reflect is a valuable practice.

If you could change one thing about this situation, what would it be?

What support do you need right now?

The content does not constitute professional advice in any field including but not limited to: medical, psychological, financial, legal, or relationship advice.

If you need professional support, please consult qualified professionals in the relevant field.

All cycle analysis is generated for pattern awareness and self-understanding purposes and should not be used as the basis for important life decisions.

life_path.title: What is life path number?
life_path.answer1: Life path number is the foundational number pattern calculated from your birth date.
life_path.answer2: It reflects the path you tend to walk in this life.
life_path.answer3: It ranges from 1 to 9 (and master numbers 11, 22, 33).
life_path.calc1: All digits of your birth date are added together.
life_path.calc2: It is reduced until a single digit is reached.
life_path.tells1: Your deeper purpose in this life.
life_path.tells3: Challenges and lessons you may encounter.
life_path.note1: Life path number is not a fixed path.
life_path.note2: It shows potential, decisions are yours.
life_path.note3: Every number has both light and shadow sides.
life_path.suggestion: What does daily number energy tell?

falling.short_answer_1: Falling dreams usually reflect a feeling of loss of control.
falling.short_answer_2: They appear when we feel like things are slipping away from us.
falling.short_answer_3: Waking up while falling is your subconscious's reflex to wake you.
falling.meaning_1: More common during times of uncertainty.
falling.meaning_2: You might be worried about work, relationships, or health.
falling.meaning_3: The speed of the fall shows the intensity of anxiety.
falling.recurring_2: Look at what makes you feel unstable in life.
falling.recurring_3: Accepting what you cannot control can bring relief.

water.short_answer_1: Water symbolizes the subconscious and emotions.
water.short_answer_2: The state of water reflects your inner world.
water.short_answer_3: Calm water shows peace, turbulent water shows turmoil.
water.state_title: What Does the Water's State Tell You?
water.state_1: Clear water: Mental clarity and emotional balance.
water.state_2: Murky water: Uncertainty or suppressed emotions.
water.state_3: Flowing water: Harmony with life's flow.
water.state_4: Still water: Time for introspection and reflection.
water.emotion_1: Swimming: Being at peace with emotions.
water.emotion_2: Falling into water: Emotions taking control.
water.recurring_1: You're trying to process an emotional issue.
water.recurring_2: There may be a need for inner cleansing.
water.recurring_3: You're learning to trust your intuition more.

flying.short_answer_1: Flying dreams reflect the desire for freedom and transcending limits.
flying.short_answer_2: Shows you've taken or want to take control.
flying.short_answer_3: The ease of flight symbolizes the flow in your life.
flying.feeling_1: Enjoyable flight: Confidence and sense of success.
flying.feeling_3: Fear of falling: Insecurity or doubt.
flying.meaning_1: Desire to break free from restrictions.
flying.cant_fly_1: You're struggling to believe in yourself.
flying.cant_fly_2: An obstacle is holding you back.
flying.cant_fly_3: It might be time to let go of control.

running.short_answer_1: Running dreams show the desire to escape from a situation or emotion.
running.short_answer_2: There might be something you're avoiding confronting.
running.short_answer_3: Being caught while running makes you feel escape isn't working.
running.meaning_1: There's a challenging situation in your life.
running.meaning_2: You might be running from responsibility or conflict.
running.meaning_3: What you're running from is usually within yourself.
running.from_1: From someone familiar: Unresolved issue with that person.
running.from_2: From a monster: Your own fears.
running.from_3: From vague danger: General state of anxiety.
running.recurring_1: There's a decision you've been putting off.
running.recurring_2: It might be time to face rather than run.
running.recurring_3: A dream where the escape ends shows the solution has begun.

lost.short_answer_1: Being lost reflects a feeling of losing direction and uncertainty.
lost.short_answer_2: Shows you don't know where life is taking you.
lost.short_answer_3: Could be a search for identity or purpose.
lost.where_1: City: Lost direction in social life.
lost.where_4: Familiar place: You're questioning what you know.
lost.meaning_1: You're struggling to make a decision.
lost.meaning_2: You feel you've lost control of your life.
lost.meaning_3: You're searching for who you are or what you want.
lost.find_2: Getting help: You're open to accepting support.

losing.short_answer_1: Losing someone dreams usually reflect fear of separation.
losing.short_answer_2: Doesn't have to be a real loss, it's a feeling of losing connection.
losing.short_answer_3: There may be unresolved feelings about that person.
losing.who_1: A loved one: Your attachment and fear of loss.
losing.who_2: A stranger: Your connection to yourself.
losing.who_3: A child: Innocence within or new beginnings.
losing.meaning_1: You might be experiencing fear of change.
losing.meaning_2: You feel distance in a relationship.
losing.recurring_1: Your fear of loss may have deepened.
losing.recurring_2: There's something you need to discuss with that person.
losing.recurring_3: You're seeking balance between independence and attachment.

past.short_answer_1: Someone from the past symbolizes unfinished feelings.
past.short_answer_2: It might be about that era, not that person.
past.short_answer_3: The subconscious is processing an old issue.
past.who_3: Someone who passed: Grief process or longing.
past.who_4: Someone from childhood: Past trauma or nostalgia.
past.meaning_1: The emotion you experienced then is still active.
past.meaning_2: A current situation may have triggered the past.
past.meaning_3: It may be time to forgive or let go.
past.recurring_1: You need to resolve something about that person.
past.recurring_2: The past is affecting the present.
past.recurring_3: Time to separate yourself from that era.

searching.short_answer_1: Searching dreams reflect feelings of lack or loss.
searching.short_answer_2: Shows you're chasing something in life.
searching.short_answer_3: What you're searching for explains what you need.
searching.what_1: An object: A lost trait or ability.
searching.what_2: A person: Need for connection or relationship.
searching.what_3: A place: Search for security or belonging.
searching.what_4: Vague: Search for direction in life.
searching.meaning_2: You're looking for answers but don't know where.
searching.meaning_3: You might be in a period of inner searching.
searching.not_found_1: There's something you're not ready for yet.
searching.not_found_2: What you're looking for might be within you.

darkness.short_answer_1: Darkness symbolizes the unknown and unexplored inner world.
darkness.short_answer_2: There may be emotions or thoughts you're not aware of.
darkness.short_answer_3: Can be read as an invitation to discovery, not fear.
darkness.action_title: What Did You Do in the Dark?
darkness.action_3: Were afraid: You're wary of the unknown.
darkness.action_4: Searched for light: Looking for clarity and meaning.
darkness.meaning_1: You're in an uncertain period in life.
darkness.meaning_2: There are parts of yourself you haven't met.
darkness.meaning_3: You're suppressing a secret or hidden emotion.
darkness.recurring_2: You're being invited on an inner journey.
darkness.recurring_3: Light comes after the darkness passes.

voiceless.short_answer_1: Being voiceless reflects feeling unable to express yourself.
voiceless.why_1: Voice didn't come out: Suppressed emotions.
voiceless.why_3: Screamed but nothing came out: Intense frustration.
voiceless.meaning_2: You can't express yourself on some matter.
voiceless.recurring_1: You're struggling to make your voice heard.
voiceless.recurring_3: There's someone you need to talk to.

unable_to_fly.short_answer_1: Being unable to fly reflects feeling you can't use your potential.
unable_to_fly.short_answer_2: You perceive an obstacle or limitation.
unable_to_fly.short_answer_3: You want freedom but something holds you back.
unable_to_fly.why_2: Fear: You're afraid of success or failure.
unable_to_fly.why_3: Falling: You feel a lack of confidence.
unable_to_fly.why_4: Physical obstacle: External conditions limiting you.
unable_to_fly.meaning_1: You're struggling to believe in yourself.
unable_to_fly.meaning_2: You have a fear of missing an opportunity.
unable_to_fly.meaning_3: You might need to let go of control.
unable_to_fly.recurring_2: Your inner critic is too strong.
unable_to_fly.recurring_3: To learn to fly, you must accept falling.

recurring.short_answer_1: Recurring dreams point to an unresolved issue.
recurring.short_answer_2: The subconscious is trying to get your attention.
recurring.short_answer_3: It repeats until the message is understood.
recurring.why_2: An ongoing source of stress in your life.
recurring.what_to_do_1: Note the dream, record the details.
recurring.what_to_do_3: Think about what in life it might connect to.
recurring.what_to_do_4: Try to consciously address the issue.
recurring.when_stops_2: When you take action on the related matter.
recurring.when_stops_3: When you release the emotional burden.

Now shine in the light of meaning.

The {mainSymbol} symbol illuminated my path.

The energy of {archetype} embraced my whole being.

Shadows dancing in the moonlight,
{mainSymbol} told me stories.
I walk in the footsteps of {archetype},
I've etched my dream's wisdom into my heart.

symbol_acknowledgments.snake: The snake is one of the most powerful and multilayered symbols in dreams. It can carry many meanings such as transformation, renewal, hidden knowledge, or inner threats.
symbol_acknowledgments.water: Water is a universal symbol representing emotional state and the subconscious in dreams. The state of water - calm, turbulent, clear or murky - carries important clues.
symbol_acknowledgments.flying: Flying is a powerful experience in dreams that can point to themes of freedom, high goals, or escape from reality.
symbol_acknowledgments.falling: Falling dreams can reflect fears of losing control, insecurity, or felt before a major change.
symbol_acknowledgments.teeth: Teeth dreams may be related to loss, change, appearance concerns, or communication issues.
symbol_acknowledgments.death: Death dreams are often not literal. They can symbolize transformation, the end of a period, or a major change.
symbol_acknowledgments.being_chased: Being chased dreams can represent emotions, responsibilities, or fears that are being avoided.
symbol_acknowledgments.baby: Baby dreams can symbolize new beginnings, creative projects, or your connection to your inner child.
symbol_acknowledgments.house: A house in dreams is seen as a reflection of the self and inner world. The condition of the house and rooms can represent different life areas.
symbol_acknowledgments.car: Car dreams point to themes of control, direction, and progress on life's journey.
symbol_acknowledgments.dog: A dog can represent loyalty, friendship, or our instinctive sides. The dog's behavior carries important clues.
symbol_acknowledgments.cat: A cat is associated with independence, intuition, and mystery. It can also symbolize feminine energy and inner wisdom.
symbol_acknowledgments.money: Money dreams may reflect themes of value, self-worth, and access to resources.
symbol_acknowledgments.exam: Exam dreams may be about performance anxiety, fear of judgment, or life tests.
symbol_acknowledgments.nakedness: Nakedness dreams are related to vulnerability, expression of authentic self, or shedding masks.
symbol_acknowledgments.getting_lost: Getting lost dreams may reflect feelings of losing direction in life, identity searching, or uncertainty.
symbol_acknowledgments.fire: Fire can represent passion, anger, transformation, or purification. Whether the fire is controlled or uncontrolled is important.
symbol_acknowledgments.blood: Blood can point to themes related to life energy, emotional wounds, or family ties.
symbol_acknowledgments.wedding: Wedding/bride dreams can symbolize union, commitment, or transition to a new phase of life.
symbol_acknowledgments.illness: Illness dreams may point to emotional or inner imbalances, areas that need attention.
symbol_acknowledgments.general: Every dream symbol carries personal meaning. What's important is discovering what this symbol means to you.

snake: Was the snake coming toward you, just sitting there, or moving away?
What was the dominant feeling? (fear, tension, curiosity, calm)
Was the environment enclosed (room/house) or open (nature)?
falling: Did the fall feel like losing control or like letting go?
Did you hit the ground or wake up mid-fall?
Was the fall from a great height or short?
being_chased: Who or what was chasing you? (clear or unclear)
What was the dominant feeling? (fear, panic, anger)
death: Who was dying in the dream? (you or someone else)
Was the death violent or peaceful?
What did you feel afterward? (relief, fear, emptiness)
fire: Was the fire controlled or spreading?
Were you an observer or intervening?
water: How did the water look? (clear, murky, wavy, calm)
Were you in the water or outside it?
Was the water moving or still?
flying: Were you in control or carried by the wind?
teeth: How were the teeth falling? (by themselves, by impact, crumbling)
Was there anyone watching or noticing?
What did you feel during the falling?
baby: Was the baby related to you? (your child, someone else's)
What was the baby's state? (happy, crying, sick)
Were you holding or watching the baby?
house: Was the house familiar or unknown?
What was the condition of the house? (tidy, messy, damaged)
Which part of the house were you in?
car: Were you driving or a passenger?
Was there control or loss of control in the drive?
Where were you going? (known destination or unknown)
exam: What was the exam about? (school, life test)
What was the outcome? (passed, failed, unknown)
nakedness: Where were you naked? (public, private place)
What did you feel? (shame, comfort, fear)
getting_lost: Where were you lost? (known place, unknown place)
Could you ask for directions or find help?
What was the dominant feeling? (panic, curiosity)
general: What was the dominant emotion in the dream?
Did you recognize anyone or anywhere?
What was your position in the dream? (observer, participant)

surface_messages.korku: An alarm is sounding within. Your subconscious wants to warn you about something.
surface_messages.huzur: You are in inner balance. This dream celebrates your peace.
surface_messages.merak: New doors are opening in your mind. This dream is inviting you to explore.
surface_messages.sucluluk: A burden of consciousness wants to speak. You might be carrying an unresolved feeling from the past.
surface_messages.ozlem: A valuable part of your inner self is missing. Something is calling you back.
surface_messages.heyecan: Energy is rising - something new is on the horizon.
surface_messages.donukluk: Emotions are temporarily muted - a protection mechanism.
surface_messages.ofke: Boundaries have been pushed - power wants to be reclaimed.

deeper_meanings.korku: Beneath fear there is usually love. What are you afraid of losing?
deeper_meanings.huzur: This peace signals conflict resolved. Which inner war has ended?
deeper_meanings.merak: Curiosity is the inner call to grow. You are ready to open to the unknown.
deeper_meanings.sucluluk: Guilt is sometimes internalizing others' voices. Whose voice is this?
deeper_meanings.ozlem: Longing is the desire to return to lost wholeness. When did you feel whole?
deeper_meanings.heyecan: Excitement is the peak of life energy. Where will you direct this energy?
deeper_meanings.donukluk: Numbness is protection from feeling too much. What are you avoiding feeling?
deeper_meanings.ofke: Anger is the voice of suppressed power. Where do you want your power back?

shadow_questions.korku: What would happen if what you fear came true?
shadow_questions.merak: What question are you afraid to find the answer to?
shadow_questions.sucluluk: What would change if you forgave yourself?
shadow_questions.ozlem: If what you long for returned, could you accept it?
shadow_questions.heyecan: What remains when this excitement fades?
shadow_questions.donukluk: If you were to feel, what would you feel?
shadow_questions.ofke: What pain lies beneath the anger?

integration_paths.korku: Face your fear, but be gentle. Approach what you fear in small steps.
integration_paths.huzur: Remember this peace and carry it into daily life. Reinforce with meditation.
integration_paths.merak: Write down your questions, learn to live with questions rather than seeking answers.
integration_paths.sucluluk: Examine the guilt: is it real or learned? Write a letter to yourself.
integration_paths.ozlem: Honor the longing but stay present. Accepting loss opens doors to the future.
integration_paths.heyecan: Transform excitement into action. Take a step today.
integration_paths.donukluk: Return to your body. Move, breathe, slowly begin to feel.
integration_paths.ofke: Express anger healthily: sports, writing, creativity. But don't hurt anyone.

avoidances.korku: This week, avoid impulsive decisions made to escape fear.
avoidances.huzur: Gently distance yourself from those who want to disturb your peace.
avoidances.ozlem: Avoid getting stuck in the past.
avoidances.heyecan: Avoid scattering your energy, stay focused.
